CatDescriptText: Earl Pollard, Yellow Cab driver, 713 Seal Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 24, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the increasing demand for father and mother to work, thus taking both parents out of the home for the better part of the day, affects their children as regards discipline, ambition, and social compatibility in general?" answer reads: "Yes, it has an affect.  I say that the mother should be home with the children in order to keep an eye on what they are doing, a job which can not be done as well by others."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Earl Pollard wearing light colored hat, eyeglasses, moustache, patterned knit scarf, and leather jacket, standing with hands in pockets on sidewalk in front of stone wall building
